ISSUE.TITLE: Address warnings in Dockerfiles
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Recent updates to Docker have started showing some warnings with our current set of Dockerfiles, similar to this: ``` 10 warnings found (use --debug to expand): - ConsistentInstructionCasing: Command 'copy' should match the case of the command majority (uppercase) (line 99) - FromAsCasing: 'as' and 'FROM' keywords' casing do not match (line 8) - FromAsCasing: 'as' and 'FROM' keywords' casing do not match (line 60) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 12) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 13) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 71) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 72) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 73) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 114) - LegacyKeyValueFormat: "ENV key=value" should be used instead of legacy "ENV key value" format (line 115) ``` They are just warnings, and the images build correctly, but at some point they should be addressed.
